title: Please help me with this one..
content:
I remember seeing a font that I absolutely loved - but since I saw it in a magazine that wasnt mine (and that didnt list the fonts they were using) I dont know the name of the font.. but even worse, I dont have any pictures of it.. So I have really quickly drawn a sketch of the letter M to get the feeling of what the font is about. The curl is the main ingredient of the font..

So if you know any kind of font that may look a bit like my bad sketch, do not hesitate to name drop!!

Thank you so very very very much!!! ;o)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Bilde 5.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317140151/http:/typophile.com/files/Bilde%205_0.png) | 8.14 KB |
author: marenhei

comments.content:
Kris Sowersby's custom designed Methven Flow?

[http://www.klim.co.nz/custom\_methvenflow.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317140151/http:/www.klim.co.nz/custom_methvenflow.php "http://www.klim.co.nz/custom\_methvenflow.php")
Or perhaps [Los Niches](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317140151/http:/new.typographica.org/2008/typeface-reviews/los-niches/) by Juan Pablo de Gregorio.

Try [Fontleroy](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317140151/http:/www.cheapprofonts.com/Fontleroy_Bundle.php), too.

See FAQ #2: Please use a [descriptive title for your posting](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317140151/http:/typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq/#Q_2) next time.
I think you mean Monocle Magazine? [http://www.monocle.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317140151/http:/www.monocle.com/ "http://www.monocle.com/")
